item.title: Antilag file **help please!**
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

You might as well protect your server from the bots by restricting people from logging in from the same computer more than once or by removing thread-per-client. You can find tutorials for both of these in the tutorial section.

Read full topic

item.title: Antilag file **help please!**
item.dc:creator: @1337haxaz 1337haxaz
item.description:
@1337haxaz wrote:

Ok so here’s my problem, there’s a lot of lifeless ppl that crashes the server when im @ school our outside… I found this little file “antilag” and i opened it, here’s what i have [code]// This resets server every 30 mins to stop lag - xerozcheez
import java.io.*;

public class antilag {

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver() {
    misc.println("RESETING SERVER!!!");
    misc.println("Saving all games...");
    PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
    misc.println("GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS");
    ResetTimer = 0;
    closeListener();
    runserver();
}

public void process() {
    ResetTimer += 1;
    if (ResetTimer >= 9999999) {
        resetserver();
    }
}

public void runserver() {
    try {
        String run = "runserver.bat";
        String xstr = "./" + run;

        Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);
    } catch (IOException ioe) {
        ioe.printStackTrace();
    } 
}

public void closeListener() {
    try {
        server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
        if (server.clientListener != null) {
            server.clientListener.close();
        }
        server.clientListener = null;
    } catch (java.lang.Exception __ex) {
        __ex.printStackTrace();
    }
}

}
[/code]
Is there any way to make it so it restart every 30 minutes? Just in cash of AGF bot happens…

Read full topic
